content.description: Start on the arete. Go up on crimpy rails before traversing right below the sign letters. THE LETTERS DO NOT HOLD WEIGHT. Use the concrete ledge as a hand to bridge up to the next rail, and top out on the very top of the sign.
Start on the first ledge below the windowsill, and use monos and arêtes to pull yourself to the next ledge. The windowsill is the finish, and topping out is optional.
content.location:
It is located next to

3 Finger Box Combo

behind the chemistry building. There are several windows with the same climb.

content.description: Wagar Columns has straightforward climbing in a neat position on the Oval. The roof is a little tricky to pull but manageable.
content.location: These climb the Wagar Building's North side.

content.description: Start using the door frame as sidepull and the handicap button as a high foot. Send up to twisty, exposed tiles. Traverse to the corner, climb to the window, traverse across, and end at the top of the first column (or second if desired). Downclimb the column.
content.location: This is just right of the waterfall at the NESB Building.

content.description: Smoke Signals is an awesome, easy climb on nice holds. Stay low and walk to the furthest east greenhouse for a beautiful smoke spot. We'll try and reply if you send messages via smoke signals.
content.location: It is on the North side of the Weed Research Lab on an obvious white wall.

content.description: This is on the boulder on campus outside of the Gym. Try traversing around the whole boulder.
content.protection: Whatever you want. No crashpad is necessary unless trying to make something difficult.
content.location: It is directly in front of the Gym on campus.

content.description: Climb pinchy sandstone all the way up. Be careful getting onto the ledge.
content.location: This climbs the North-facing corner by northeast entrance to Behavioral Sciences. Set a pad down between the bike rack and the corner. Enjoy people watching from a great lookout spot.

content.description: This is a lovely route featuring the circular holds on one side of the dihedral and typical ledges for your right hand. Enjoy the view!
content.location: It is on the West side of Lory Student Center, towards the North end.

content.description: Traverse wide gaps between the three stacks.

Have you ever been on the wall and went for a pinch only to just slide off? If this is the case, you should probably hop on the mirrors edge traverse. It starts on the right side by the door and traverses a very visually pleasing line. Stay on the metal edge, and use the pinches get to the other door. Once you find the sequence, it's all just a pumpfest to the end.
content.location: It is on the second floor of the Lory Student Center facing the rec center.

content.description:
Take the bricks on either side of the East entrance to Eddy Hall Building up to a large ledge over the entrance, and run the ledge (which is in full view of everyone) to the other side and downclimb.

Per

Gavin E

: this building was remodeled, and the problem no longer exists.
content.location: This is on the East side of the CSU building Eddy Hall.

content.description:
Start on the corner at the base of the grassy slope. Climb up until you can get a hand on top of the roof edge. It will likely be kind of slick with dust, so bump your feet up, and make sure you can grip around the back of the roof railing before trying to go over it. From here, go west to the cooling tower, and climb either the east face dihedral or the south face chimney.

The descent is a downclimb of the way you came up or slightly to the left of where you came up where the hill meets the building higher up.
content.protection: A pad or two on the grass wouldn't be bad, but visual exposure is a concern, so the lower profile you can be, the better.
content.location: It is on the South side of the Laurel Village Pavilion.

content.description: Follow the dihedral along the stained glass. Mind the lights behind you.
Climb sandstone pinches on bottom half followed by mono-pocket crux and the top half with more sandstone pinches. Fuck Kaye!
content.location: It is under the bridge in between Forestry and Warner on the north side of the doorway in the corner.

content.description: Hartshorn Direct has straightforward climbing on mega-jugs. I hope to include the windrow traverse.
content.location: It is on the North side of Hartshorn.

content.description: Fort Squidward is a series of climbs between ledges that traverse counter-clockwise around the tower on the North side of Durrell. There's a neat little fort on top and a ladder to the SE.
Ring the motherfucker and dip. Watch for cops. Swing the thing hard.
content.location: This goes to the bell on the Northeast side of Canvas stadium.

content.description: Use the bulletin board, light conduit, and ledge in this tough mantle problem. Set up a pad on the stairs, and have spotters ready. For the downclimb, lay on your stomach, drop your legs, and wiggle until slowly dropping to a hang.
content.location:
This is on the Southeast corner of Clark C on the North end of stairs by the door. It is across the sidewalk from "

The Perch

."

content.description: Pick one of the obvious cracks on the east side of the building, and either lean back or foot jam your way up.
content.location: This problem is on the east side of the Environmental Health building.

content.description: Start on the sandstone wall, climb up about 10 feet, traverse over to the white wall using the indented squares as holds. Climb to the top of the wall, traverse over, and downclimb.
content.location: This climb is on the west side of the Global Food Innovation Center Building (between Clark and weed lab).

content.description: Ascend easy ledges up to a nice sittin' ledge. You get a bonus point for getting a Bird scooter up there.
content.protection: Maybe a pad, but it is not necessary.
content.location: On the Northside of LSC Plaza is a small clock tower.

content.description:
The route consists mostly of arêtes and pretty solid monos. It starts on the left corner, and from there, you traverse across the wall (try not to use the windowsills but climb across it). Once you hit the corner with the wall that has the door, you mantel to the corner to rest, continue traversing over the door, and repeat with the next corner and wall.

Note: campus security doesn't give a crap what you do as long as you have pads.
content.location: This route is located behind the chemistry building next to the big red sculpture, yellow pole, and blue metal thing. The visual arts building is directly across the bike path from the traverse.

content.description: Climb up the back end by grabbing the horse's back leg and doing a "beached whale" move. Continue up and around the front of the horse being careful not to grab the lasso or less solid parts of the sculpture. Drop off the "snow" once you have returned to the back of the horse.
